Question_Text: What is your real screen time yesterday (hours + top 2 apps)? Write the number, not the story.
When you try to focus, what is the first urge: check phone, open a new tab, snack, or move?
What is your ‘scroll trance’ trigger (boredom, anxiety, loneliness, fatigue)? Choose 1.
Over the last 7 days, how consistent was your wake time? (± minutes)
What is your first body complaint after long screen sessions (eyes/neck/jaw/head)?
Caffeine timing: what time is your last caffeine most days? What happens if you skip it?
List the top 3 notification sources that hijack your attention (app + purpose).
How many tabs do you have open right now? What emotion is underneath keeping them open?
What is the smallest unit of work you can do for 10 minutes with zero context switching?
When you are forced to wait (loading screen, traffic), what does your mind do within 30 seconds?
Your sleep latency: how many minutes from lights-out to sleep? What usually delays it?
What time do you get your first real daylight exposure most days? (minutes outside)
Name your top 2 sensory irritants during work (sound/light/temperature).
How often do you move your body during work blocks (minutes per hour)?
Do you eat while working/screens? What happens to focus 30 minutes later?
What is your ‘shutdown tell’ when overstimulated (numbness, anger, dissociation)?
Hydration check: does low water intake correlate with brain fog today (yes/no)?
Rate morning grogginess 1–10. What did you do in the final 60 minutes before bed?
Identify your top context switch (Slack/email/social). How many times per hour?
What do you call ‘research’ that is actually avoidance? Name one example from this week.
When you hit discomfort, do you switch tasks or increase stimulation? Which is your default?
Describe your phone reach loop: where is it physically, and when do you touch it first?
What single boundary would reduce distractions by 50%? Choose one and state the rule.
What is the one task you ‘almost start’ daily but never enter? What blocks minute 1–5?
What emotion are you trying not to feel when you scroll? Name the primary one.
Where do you demand certainty that deep work cannot provide (results, praise, perfect plan)?
What belief do you hold about boredom (dangerous, wasteful, intolerable, weak)?
When you’re behind, do you increase inputs (more videos/tools) or reduce scope? Which is your default?
What fear do you disguise as ‘being informed’ (missing out, irrelevance, failure)?
If you stopped optimizing, what would you be forced to face about your identity?
What is your internal start rule: ‘must feel ready’ or ‘start messy’? Which costs you more?
How often do you rebuild systems instead of executing them? What emotion drives the rebuild?
When you lose focus, do you blame discipline or environment? Which lever is cheaper to change today?
List 3 low-dopamine activities that reliably restore you (no screens).
What is one analog anchor you could do daily for 10 minutes (walk, paper, breath)?
Who is one person you can co-regulate with instead of scrolling (text/call)?
Define your ‘done for today’ rule. What is your minimum exit criterion?
What reward can you give your brain after deep work that isn’t digital stimulation?
Create a 2-hour no-notifications window. When will it be this week (day/time)?
Name your top 3 temptation apps. What is the rule for each (delete/block/timebox)?
Define your one-tab rule: what is the single tab you must keep open while building/writing?
What will you stop consuming for 7 days (podcasts/news/social)? Why that one?
Choose one capture system (notes). What is the rule for capturing vs acting?
Write a 3-line deep work preflight checklist you will use before starting.
What one metric will you track daily (deep work minutes OR phone pickups)? Choose one.
Set a sleep-protection boundary: what time do screens go off, and what replaces them?
Pick one sensory patch for work (earplugs/light/desk). Which one, and when will you deploy it?
Name the single highest-leverage change you discovered. Write it as a command.
Define your 7-day analog recovery ritual (what, when, where, with whom).
What is the 5% truer sentence about your attention problem that you avoid writing?
